attributes.action: Change National Planning Policy which permits inappropriate housing development
attributes.background: The current government planning policy means that if councils don't have a 5 year land supply for housing developers can cast aside planning policy and build on our beautiful countryside.  Local opinion and landscape designation are ignored resulting in development on greenfield sites.
attributes.additional_details: Across the country our neighbourhoods are under threat by developers who speculatively submit planning applications knowing that our councils don't have the finances or resources to challenge them.  There is clearly a need for more housing however a huge amount of brownfield available with planning permission which developers are land banking whilst they exploit the weakness in our planning policy that enables them to force through development on cheaper to develop greenfield sites.

attributes.action: Use funding used for TV's in prison cells for TV's for the elderly in hospital
attributes.background: Many elderly people who have fallen or become unwell, have no relations, comfort or entertainment in hospital, yet prisons continue to have TVs for prisoners, who have other entertainment, and social lives, this funding should be prioritised to help older or vulnerable people, with nothing else.
attributes.additional_details: After having worked for many years in the health care sector, I have seen many vulnerable adults with no family network endure a time in hospital with no comforts, family or friends, for someone elderly or with dementia this can be unfamiliar and scary, due to funding, TVs cannot be provided for beds in many hospitals around the UK, yet many prison cells have TVs, on top of a social life, a small allowance and more. These TV's could be used to make the day brighter for those with nothing else.

attributes.action: Make driving a Motorcycle with no protective clothing / leathers illegal.
attributes.background: My Dad was involved in a serious bike accident, which bought home to our family the seriousness and how dangerous it can really be. I am tired of seeing people riding motorcycles with just a helmet, I cannot watch another family go through what we have.

attributes.action: I want the Meningitis B vaccination to be free for everyone in the UK
attributes.background: Recently whilst on holiday in Barcelona I fell ill with bacterial meningitis. As a child I was not offered the vaccination which could have potentionally prevented me from getting this horrific and life threatening disease. Instead of having a three day holiday I was in hospital for two weeks.
attributes.additional_details: I want this strain of meningitis to be prevented by the vaccination being available to everyone that may need it.  I understand babies are now being given the vaccination. But all others that are not vaccinated are still at risk and deserve to be prevented for free!!!

attributes.action: Fund Home Schooling For SEN Children that cannot access mainstream schools
attributes.background: My two children have autism spectrum disorder and also suffer with anxiety. They find going into the school impossible. Since taking them out of school they are doing fantastic. But this as caused us to reduce our working hours and causes us financial problems. All we need is a little help
attributes.additional_details: If like with in elderly care a percentsge of the money set aside for a childs education could be paid to parents to home educate a child with special educational needs. It would enable child to recieve a good quality home education and relieve the financial burdon on the family.

attributes.action: UK Government to stop using the term 'Islamic State' & refer to them as 'Daesh'.
attributes.background: In the wake of many terrorist attacks around the world, the British Government must not associate the religious beliefs of 3 million UK Muslims with that of a terrorist organisation. Doing so aids hate crimes and the social campaigns of the terrorists. The name "Daesh" should be used in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: I am a Muslim living in the UK. When I hear the term "Islamic State", "ISIL" or "so-called Islamic State", I wonder why we are assisting the terrorists in their hate campaigns. I find it an insult to hear the term used, as would the 400,000 Muslims that served this land in World War 1 or currently serving in the army. These terrorists are referred to as "Daesh" in predominantly Muslim countries. The term "Islamic State" is a perversion of a religion, consisting of 23% of the global population.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to direct hatred and abuse at any societal groups.
attributes.background: Racism and xenophobia have been legitimised in post-Brexit campaign Britain. We need to prevent extremist politicians, pressure groups and newspapers from inciting the hatred that has led to children being called 'vermin' and told to 'go home', and offensive slogans appearing in our cities.
attributes.additional_details: We would like Parliament to pass legislation making it illegal to target ANY group of people with hate messages, whether spoken, written or pictorial, so that politicians, pressure groups and newspapers can no longer use sensationalist headlines that scapegoat specific groups in society and make them a target for racism, xenophobia and other forms of hatred and abuse.

attributes.action: For the UK to hold a General Election within 12 months of the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The resigning Prime Minister, Rt Hon. David Cameron, held a referendum for the people to vote on leaving or remaining in the EU.
With the result in favour of the "Leave" campaign he announced his intention to leave his post, paving the way for an unelected Prime Minister after less than 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the massive turnout in the referendum & the decision of their elected leader to leave his post, the people of the United Kingdom, deserve to elect a new Prime Minister. 
This decision should not be left to  the Conservative party as the country now finds itself in entirely new circumstances and any new PM chosen by them, would not be properly recognised by the public.
A General Election should be held within 12 months of the result of the E.U. Referendum (No later than 1st July 2017).

attributes.action: Introduce stronger laws on anti-Islamism.
attributes.background: Muslims in Britain are facing increased hostility, prejudice and discrimination. Stop the negative portrayal of a whole religion and terming 'terrorism' with Islam in the media. Ordinary Muslims do not need to suffer for the actions of a minority.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of recent terrorist attacks; including the Paris and Orlando shootings, the whole religion of Islam has been constantly blamed in the media for the actions of criminals. There is nothing Islamic about committing any forms of abuses. Help stop bigotry in all the media and our institutions so that ordinary Muslims can live normal lives in Britain.

attributes.action: Make RAF Mildenhall a Theme Park/Water Park or Shopping Centre.
attributes.background: RAF Mildenhall is shutting shop in 2022 so let's turn it into something useful for the community. Not an Airport not more houses something for the local community and economy

attributes.action: Make it illegal to discrimination against families when renting property.
attributes.background: Tennants with children are finding it increasingly difficult to rent a suitable, 2 bedroom property. Landlords and agents are using the unfair excuse that children cause extra wear on the property, yet a deposit is still taken to cover damages. It is leaving young families in difficult situations
attributes.additional_details:
My partner and I are currently facing homelessness after being served a section 21 on our flat. The landlord has decided to renovate the property, but will not allow children in it once it is finished. 
While searching for a new place for us to live, we are consistently met with the "No pets, No Children" statement.Like our daughter is as low as a dog! We live in an expensive area and are struggling to find suitable properties that allow children. 
I have contacted numerous agents and no differ.

attributes.action: Ensure that all PIP assessment centres are accessible by those who cannot walk
attributes.background: Too many PIP assessment centres are not accessible to people with walking difficulties, in that the nearest car park is too far away, or the assessment rooms are not on the ground floor. The government needs to ensure all assessment centres have accessible parking and disabled lifts.

attributes.action: Free blood tests for people putting themselves forward as Living Donors.
attributes.background:
If someone is willing to be a Living Donor, undergo invasive surgery to change peoples lives, and at the same time save the NHS money - surely, we can provide them a blood group certificate on the NHS and not ask them to pay for it? 
It's a selfless act, & being forced to go private is prohibitive.
attributes.additional_details:
I've lived with CKD for ten years, and now I am in need of a transplant or face years of dialysis. I am so lucky that a group of people have come forward as potential Living Donors.

These people are willing to undergo invasive surgery to change lives. This surgery would also save the NHS millions, transplanting kidneys is more cost efficient than dialysis. 

It's the principle - if someone is willing to undertake such a selfless act, as a society let's not ask them to pay for the privilege.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to Trigger Article 50 and repeal EC Act 1972.
attributes.background: We live in a Democracy and the EU Referendum result should be honoured by the Government.  Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty must be triggered and the European Communities Act 1972 should be repealed.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: Give more funding to brain tumour research.
attributes.background: Government spend on brain tumour research represented just 0.52% of its total spend on cancer research.  This cancer is the biggest killer of the under 40 age group. More funding is needed to help research this most aggressive form of cancer that is killing so many people.

attributes.action: Leave the clocks on British Summer Time all year round.
attributes.background: Light evenings in the summer are widely enjoyed but it is a little depressing when the hours of daylight begin to shorten. Then there is the sudden jolt of even earlier darkness when the clocks go back one hour. Why not leave the clocks alone and allow gradual acceptance of the shorter days?
attributes.additional_details: It has been done before (1968 to 1971) and it has been debated many times. With the UK leaving the EU there will be no European requirement for a common summer time but, in effect, summer time would not be changed anyway. If businesses wish to keep in step with their international partners it should be easy enough for them to change their trading hours to suit; a side-effect of this could be to stagger business hours thus reducing rush-hour congestion and pollution. In areas such as northern Scotland where all-year BST would mean a mid-morning sunrise in the winter months surely it is not beyond the wit of men and women to adjust working hours as appropriate. Alternatively they could learn to live with it as do millions of people in other northern locations.

attributes.action: Reinstate the weekly Widows' Pension (abolished in April 2001)
attributes.background: The weekly Widows' Pension was abolished in April 2001 and now the Conservative Government are delaying the payment of our State Pension which we and our employers have paid into and which is rightfully ours.

attributes.action: Work with governments in other countries to take action against child soldiers
attributes.background:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against.
#ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou
attributes.additional_details:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against. 
 We decided child soldiers as children younger than us are being kidnapped and forced to become soldiers. This is something we feel strongly and passionate about as it is something that affects children and their lives. #ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou

attributes.action: Review above inflation interest rates applied to Plan2 Student Loans in England
attributes.background:
The Plan2 annual rate of interest while students are studying is RPI plus 3% and continues to be above RPI unless earnings stay below £21,000.
Previous Plan2 %rates (Plan1 pre-2012) are:
2012/13	 6.6% (1.5%)
2013/14	 6.3% (1.5%)
2014/15    5.5% (1.5%)
2015/16	 3.9% (0.9%)
2016/17	 4.6% (1.25%)
attributes.additional_details:
The uncertain economic future after the EU Referendum leaves Plan2 borrowers vulnerable. In addition, there is the looming threat of the Plan2 student loan book being sold to a private sector financial institution. 
This petition asks the government to review Plan2 student loans to remove above inflation interest rates and introduce a cap; thus protecting English students from becoming “an indentured class of graduates from whom higher repayments can be extracted.” (McGettigan, A)  @plan2fight

attributes.action: UK government must remain committed to the European Convention on Human Rights
attributes.background: We, the undersigned believe that The European Convention on Human Rights should be accepted as the minimum standard for Human Rights in the UK with the European Court of Human Rights as the final arbiter.
attributes.additional_details: If Human Rights are defined solely by the UK government then Human Rights can be removed from any group unpopular with that government at any time. The European Convention on Human Rights is designed to protect us from oppressive governments and its importance and necessity have not disappeared.

attributes.action: Make politicians accountable for being Clear, Fair and Not misleading.
attributes.background: The ‘clear, fair and not misleading’ requirement is used in financial services, where companies are accountable for the statements they make about their products to customers. Statements made by politicians may influence the entire country - and should at least meet this same threshold.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is in response to the misrepresentations, mistruths and lies that the electorate were fed by politicians in the EU referendum. 

Immediate admissions have been made that information in the campaigns was misleading (such as Farage stating that the £350m NHS claim was a ‘mistake’ / and Liam Fox confirming that the correct number is ‘a net £10bln’ or ‘more like £160m’, etc.) 

The UK electorate has a right to expect politicians to be clear, fair and not misleading in all statements.

attributes.action: Open negotiations to join the Schengen Area.
attributes.background: Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein are in Schengen without being in the EU. Schengen allows for free movement and common visa policy across Europe, without requiring welfare support for immigrants, and provides for police and judicial cooperation to fight transnational crime.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the European Union but many people, especially young people in Britain, value being able to travel and work freely across Europe. We value the contribution that visitors and residents from elsewhere in Europe make to our economy and society. We will likely be required to agree to freedom of movement as part of any deal to join the European Economic Area or EFTA. We could start negotiating to join Schengen before triggering formal negotiations to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Establish a constitutional convention
attributes.background: The UK has no written constitution. We also have a highly undemocratic voting system which consistently results in one party getting majority control with a minority of votes. We need a constitutional convention to address this and other issues like the House of Lords and leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Local and parliamentary elections are undemocratic as voters do not get the result they voted for overall, due to the first past the post voting system. The House of Lords is entirely appointed. We have incomplete devolution and our legislature is not set up to deal with this satisfactorily. We need a constitutional convention to address these issues and draft a written constitution. With our exit from the EU having so much impact, this is the perfect time for this initiative.

attributes.action: Impose trade sanctions on China until they end the Yulin Dog Meat Festival.
attributes.background: 10,000 dogs and cats are killed every year as part of a festival in Yulin, China. The dogs, some of which are stolen from families, are abused and killed in the most horrific ways. Dogs are sentient beings which means they experience emotions like happiness, fear and pain, just like humans do.
attributes.additional_details: The objective of this campaign is based on the old adage of 'money talks' - we need our government to step up and impose trade sanctions until China deals with this barbaric and inhumane festival once and for all.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory Sexual Education lessons in Secondary Schools in the UK
attributes.background: In the early hours of the 12th June 2016, a horrific, homophobic-fuelled attack happened in a gay club in Orlando. In response to this tragedy, I am proposing that we bring back compulsory Sexual Education Lessons, with a focus on LGBTQIA+ and Feminism in order to help eradicate homophobia.
attributes.additional_details: As a 15 year old, I can tell you levels of homophobia in Secondary Schools are high, and actual Sexual Education lessons are no longer compulsory. The school has to do something, but actual lessons are no longer compulsory. I believe that homophobia in secondary schools is a direct result of this. I am LGBTQ+, and I always see this prejudice and discrimination in school and on social media and it is sickening. Now more than ever, the UK needs to be united, and attempt to eradicate homophobia.

attributes.action: Mandatory dog bite prevention in the school and preschool curriculum
attributes.background: It has become apparent with recent tragic events the current system does not stop or decrease dog bites and hospitalisation . I feel education in dog handling and bite prevention is a key area in tackling dog bites as the largest demographic is young children , many bites can be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
Bite statistics rise every year . Far too much blame is put on the breed of dog luring many owners of other breeds into a false sense of security . Many of the worlds top trainers and behaviourists such as victoria stillwell , jo rosie , nando brown , cesar millan all disagree with breed specific legislation and promote bite prevention , education and responsible dog ownership. Nearly all dog bites are preventable . 
Lets teach our children how to be safe around dogs!

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Make all foreign vehicles entering the UK pay a road tax.
attributes.background: When we drive across the channel we are expected to pay road tax in many European countries, either by way of motorway tolls, or by purchasing a vignette.  However, any vehicle can enter the UK from Europe and are able to travel free of road tax.  Why is this allowed to carry on?
attributes.additional_details: Vignettes could be purchased at the port of entry, or on line, in much the same way as the purchase system on the borders of Switzerland and Austria.  In Switzerland we have to purchase an annual vignette, and in Austria we are able to purchase a three month vignette.  Our roads are crammed with foreign trucks, and I strongly believe that some form of British road tax should be levied to ease the burden of the high road repair costs.

attributes.action: Instigate a 2nd EU referendum, honestly campaigned and to include 16-17 yr olds
attributes.background:
EU Membership is too important to be decided by a vote based on inaccurate campaign claims and which excluded 16-17yr olds.
The EU referendum result is not legally binding. Cameron decided that the UK should be bound by it but has subsequently resigned. His decision can & should be rescinded.
attributes.additional_details:
•	The percentage difference between Leave and Remain was not great enough to trigger such a momentous course of action - 48% voted Remain 
•	16 & 17yr olds were not included - their future is at stake & their votes should be counted
•	Voters may have been swayed by false information - eg the Leave campaigners have acknowledged their NHS claims were inaccurate. All campaign claims should be regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority to ensure accuracy and honesty for both parties.

attributes.action: ban betting advertising and sponsorship on television and UK press.
attributes.background:
the level of betting advertising is growing out of control.
Its everywhere;
TV adverts
Programme sponsorship
TV channel sponsorship
Sports event sponsors

Most offer free bets, or free money bets as incentives.

Gambling is addictive and destroys family life.
attributes.additional_details:
The way in which betting companies advertise need strict control, to curb the ever increasing problem of gambling addiction.
The massive increase in the number of online betting sites being able to fund such promotional activity is testimony to their success at the expense of UK households.

This is not the kind of enterprise we should be promoting.

attributes.action: Demand the EU accounts are fully disclosed. Not been audited in 20 years.
attributes.background: The accounts going back to 1994 have shown material errors, and apparently from 1994 - 2006, they have been "not entirely" fair or accurate.  Are these accounts ever released for public scrutiny? It's administered by the EU's own "Court of auditors" who give their opinion. Their own people? Why?
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/did-auditors-sign-eu-budget/

Let's see the accounts and let 'our' auditors have a look at them.  Make things open and transparent.  Or isn't that allowed in the EU?

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid - divert to, Health, Police, Military, and Pensioners
attributes.background: Foreign aid 11 billion budget to increase by £1 billion (That is money the UK Government borrows to give away).The UK  spends more than any other country and is the second largest aid donor in the world (The Telegraph)  Despite in 2015 UK government debt amounted to £1.56 trillion(economicshelp.org)
attributes.additional_details:
In January, it emerged that civil servants had gone on a £1billion spending spree over eight weeks last year to hit the government target of allocating 0.7 per cent of national income to overseas aid.
BRITAIN's spending on foreign aid will be LARGER than the entire Home Office budget in each of the next five years - reaching a staggering £16BILLION, it was revealed. Pakistan who is a Nuclear Power and not so long ago bought a fleet of fighters off the USA get the highest amount 351 million.

attributes.action: Stop air strikes in Syria and Iraq.
attributes.background: The UK's involvement in military action endangers the lives of innocent civilians in the Middle East and here in Britain where we lay ourselves open to terrorist action. The millions spent on war could be better used to come to the aid of the desperate refugees displaced by conflict.
attributes.additional_details: So called Islamic State are clearly making life hell for the people in the territories they have occupied but by dropping bombs we are only adding to their misery. We are falling into the narrative that Isis has written for us. How can we possibly condemn terrorism whilst murdering innocent people ourselves? It is nonsensical.

attributes.action: Prostate screening for men over 45
attributes.background: 1 in 8 men will have prostrate cancer a simple blood test would help detect early rising psa levels
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience of having prostrate cancer on discovery of very low level psa I was sent for biopsy resulting in discovery of 2 tumours which meant I had to have a prostatectomy

attributes.action: Adopt a zero tolerance approach to acts of racism, in the wake of the referendum
attributes.background: Since the EU referendum, there have been numerous accounts of racism and xenophobia, where people who are in the UK legally are being abused, assaulted and/or told to "go home". A zero tolerance stance is required to show that racism and xenophobia has no place in the UK, whether in the EU or not.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075

attributes.action: Refuse any request for another Scottish independence referendum before May 2020
attributes.background: The constitution is a reserved matter and therefore no consent should be given to another Scottish referendum before May 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The Scotland Act 1998 states that the constitution is a reserved matter therefore consent has to be given by Westminster before any future Scottish independence referendum could take place.

attributes.action: Get water companies to remove water meters and stop profiteering from customers.
attributes.background:
Water bills have increased substantially over the last few years.Water companies say that its fairer system.we disagree as hard working families are paying more and  water companies are making bigger profits for their shareholders.
Its unjust and government should stop this profiteering.
attributes.additional_details: Talk to families and check the profit margins of companies responsible for providing water

attributes.action: Fund university expenditure for the production of radiolabelled Vitamin B12
attributes.background:
People with Vitamin B12 deficiency caused by Pernicious Anaemia have problems with diagnosis because the available tests are inaccurate.

The Schilling Test can accurately diagnose the cause of Vitamin B12 but is no longer performed because nobody makes the radiolabeled cobalt required.
attributes.additional_details:
Vitamin B12 blood tests are inaccurate. The test for the antibodies responsible for PA is only accurate 50% of the time.

The Schilling Test requires radiolabelled cobalt. A government-sponsored source could make it possible to reinstate this test.



Reference for inaccuracy of tests - 
http://www.bcshguidelines.com/documents/BCSH_Cobalamin_and_Folate_Guidelines_(2).docx.pdf
Reference for Schilling Test - 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schilling_test

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Improve patient choice for the use of CHC Funding
attributes.background: CCG's have cut the number of of care homes they will allow a patient to choose from to use their CHC Funding.  Patients cannot choose care settings not on these limited lists even if they are prepared to pay the top-up and they have a better CQC rating causing great upset to patients and families.
attributes.additional_details: Patients are being prevented from choosing their own care setting under CCG red tape that prevents them from choosing a home that isn't on a predetermined list.  This is the case even when a patient or their family agree to pay the top up so the cost of the home of choice is no more than any other on 'the list'.  This red tape is preventing patients from choosing homes that are close to relatives and that have a better CQC rating than ones approved by the CCG for their list.

attributes.action: Facilitate 100% mortgages for those renting privately.
attributes.background: There is gap in the 'help to buy' scheme that doesn't facilitate those people who are stuck in the private rental market.  People that regularly evidence the ability to make mortgage payment, but do not have the ability to put away enough savings to reach a 5-10% deposit.
attributes.additional_details: There is a next generation issue, of those people that have young families but are now stuck in the rental market.  Quite often the rental costs are higher than what a mortgage would cost, but due to the often higher rental changes to facilitate a family home these people can not accrue enough savings quickly enough to purchase a property.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal power instead of Dangerous Nuclear Energy
attributes.background:
UK Govt. to Invest in the creation of the Severn barrage and scrap plans for Hinkley Point. The Severn project is renewable, clean energy, it will also provide 5% of the UK's energy requirements, create 50,000 jobs and can be built within just 10 years. 
Nuclear is dirty, profit driven & dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Some facts & quotes about the project.

''The electricity generated would be equivalent to three or four nuclear power stations and thousands of wind turbines & equivalent to 8 large coal-fired power stations. ''

- Lower cost than Hinkley Point.

- The barrage will have an operational lifetime of up to 200 year.

- It would be the world's largest ever renewable energy project.

-  Damages to wildlife from project can be avoided with additional investment of £3 Billion to migrate wildlife.

attributes.action: Scrap the UK honours system
attributes.background: The honours system is anachronistic and irrelevant cronyism. It is a largely elite structure rewarding randomly selected people who are merely doing their job (often badly). If it is replaced at all it should be by a people's panel recognising only public service and sacrifice.
attributes.additional_details: Examples too numerous to list, going back decades. The latest examples include Philip Green's peerage and David Cameron's resignation list.

attributes.action: Make A.P.D. (Auditory Processing Disorder) a registered disability.
attributes.background: My husbands best friend has A.P.D. and has been told that because it is not a recognised disability he has to settle for hearing aids to help yet he has the condition which does not warrant the the use of those. It is a processing disorder not a hearing impairment.

attributes.action:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
And make cyclist use the cycle paths
attributes.background: I was driving the other day just come round the bend and there was 3 of them next to eachover taking up the road and could not pass its so dangerous
attributes.additional_details:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
I would like the government to ban cycle racing on public roads. On our busy streets their is no place for sports cycle racing, its highly dangerous with cyclists often racing three abreast and not moving in on narrow roads to allow faster traffic to pass. clubs should rent tracks to race on cars and motorbikes have to , cyclists pay no road tax,have no insurance etc, pleasure cycling and commuting should be encouraged on cycle paths only but racing banned

attributes.action: Meet full cost of Student Nurse training from National Health Contributions.
attributes.background: There is a recognised shortage of nurses in this country.  There exists the possibility that Brexit will have a further impact.  Nurses are essential to the health of our nation.  It must be an imperative of government to implement a future-proof plan to ensure the ready supply of qualified nurses.
attributes.additional_details: Any discussions previously held about the future funding of nurse training were, no doubt, pre-Brexit.  An Act of Parliament that serves to ensure the recruitment of talented people into nursing must be considered an essential and positive step.  The reliance on young people (and others) to borrow in order to fund their nursing care training renders this much-needed recruitment uncertain, and therefore at risk from external forces.  The State as priniciple employer must ensure adequate funding.

attributes.action: Build social housing for wounded soldiers
attributes.background: I would like the government to find the money to build council houses for wounded soldier's.

attributes.action: Include tattoo, body piercings & hair colour in the anti-discrimination act.
attributes.background: In an age that wants us to be accepting of unconventional values, it should be law for employers to refuse you an interview or a job for creative physical expression.
attributes.additional_details: Tattoos, body piercings and diverse hair colours are an act of freedom and self expression in a linear society that wants us to conform to physical norm. They do not affect the level of service we provide to our work sectors and every individual should be able to physically express themselves however they want no matter what job they do. It should be law as part of the anti-discrimination act to be accepting towards those with any tattoos on the body, any hair colour and any piercings.
